page.title: 03LIFE OF A FORESTER
page.content: The foresters on Paddockhurst Estate look after{2664}acres of commercial woodland.This includes over{1000}acres of coniferous woodland,{400}acres of mixed woodland,{150}acres of hardwood, {200}acres of chestnut coppice,{800} acres of coppice & standards.A typical day of a forester may be like this: {7.30.a.m.}check all the machinery is working & make sure everyone has a job. Then look at the orders for that week.{10.30.a.m.}Short break.{11.00- {1.00.p.m.}Walk around to check the men have their jobs.{1.00-2.00.p.m}break for lunch.{2.00-4.00.p.m.}measuring & counting the timber.{4.30- 6.00.p.m. office work.Even while at home timber merchants may phone him or if a tree falls down he will have to go out and deal with it. Christmas is his worst time of year because of selling the Christmas trees, summer is best.
